								step out of your mind and jump into the quantum world. Let's make this real. Think BIG.
								I MEAN REALLY REALLY BIG. Don't let your mind filter anything. Be like a 5-year-old
								talking about being an astronaut or a pilot, he does not have a conflicting thought at
								all. Be creative, powerful and idealistic. Think of your higher self-perspective.
								Imagine you have Aladdin's lamp in your hand and will make your wishes come true. Be
								BOLD AND EXPRESS YOUR TRUE SELF.</p>

							</div>
							<h3><b>Phase I-Identify& Release the Conflicting beliefs.</b></h3>
							<h4><b>A.6.7 Written Exercise:</b></h4>
							<p>Now look deep within your self and search for the conflicting belief that is most likely
								fear based and seated in the sub conscious mind. Identify that memory/feeling and set it
								aside</p>
							<p style="color:red">Example : If I launch my coaching program I will have to come out in
								the open and promote myself and I will be vulnerable and feel overwhelmed.</p>
							<h5>Identify what's stopping you from going to the next step: </h5>
							<ul>
								<li>Phase I - Identify & release the conflicting beliefs. Create space in your energy
									field. Make a decision. Go through the ritual and commit with your higher self.</li>
								<li>Phase II - Anchor the new avatar. Replace the stagnated energy with new positive
									energy. Find supporters, friends, coaches, mentors and tell them about your goals.
									Become accountable to them.</li>
							</ul>

							<div class="form-group">
								<textarea name="avatar" class="area_width" rows="3"></textarea>
								<span class="form-bar"></span>
							</div>

							<h5>Phase III - Take action and move to the next lesson</h5>
							<h4><b>A.6.8 Maanas Coaching Action Step : </b></h4>

							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">Once you have identified the conflicting beliefs you
									need to make a list of them. We all have different kinds and levels of patterns &
									addictions. Even good behaviors can be addictions. This is where we are going to
									release them and depending on your personal power, you may have to go through three
									phases. But in any case, do not allow anyone to judge you nor you should judge
									yourself.</label><br /><br /><br />
								<textarea name="identified" class="area_width" rows="3"></textarea>
								<span class="form-bar"></span>
							</div>
							<h4><b>Phase I Exercise :</b></h4>
							<p>The first phase is awareness and acknowledgment. While quite often this will work, a lot
								of deeper afflictions will need you to go to the next phase.</p>
							Exercise :
							<ol type="1">
								<li>Close your eyes & get comfortable</li>
								<li>Relax and take a few deep breaths.</li>
								<li>Bring your focus at the center of the forehead.</li>
								<li>Relax your body and be in the thoughtless state for a moment.</li>
								<li>Then, intentionally envision yourself reaching the goal you want.</li>
								<li>Watch out for the conflicting thoughts or feelings that arise in your body or mind.
								</li>
								<li>Follow that thought and find the root cause where it is coming from.</li>
								<li>When you realize that you have moved out of the goal totals and are on another
									trail, come back and open your eyes.</li>
								<li>Continue to do this exercise for a few days until you are able to walk into your
									goal-without conflicting thought.</li>
								<li>If you find yourself getting lost in the maze of the side thoughts - start making a
									list, then move to the next thought.</li>
							</ol>
							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">Using the exercise before make a list of the top 10
									conflicting thoughts and in the right-hand column give them a number based on the
									strength ( scale of 1 to 10 & 10 being highest)</label>
								<table width="100%">
									<tr>
										<td style="width:100px">1.</td>

							</div>

							<h4><b>Phase II Exercise: Releasing the conflicting beliefs.</b></h4>
							<p>In the above list, you made a list of the stubborn memories & thoughts. In this exercise,
								we are going to take those stubborn memories, behavior patterns & addictions and get
								them out of your energy field.<br />

								In this exercise, you need to take the top 3 conflicting thoughts that are the strongest
								and the highest scores. Now let us deal with each memory one at a time. Do the following
								exercise & come back and write the score in the 1st try column. If the score had not
								dropped down significantly then do the Exercise # 2. Then write down the score in the
								2nd Try column. If that does not work go to the third exercise and write the score. If
								after three tries you are still struggling then reach out to your mentor or coach to
								help you with it. We have had 97% success with these exercises, however, if it is still
								not working for you then reach out to your coach or mentor and enroll their help. We are
								always here to support you so all you have to do is click on the chat button and reach
								out to us. You are bigger than any problem you have.</p>

							<table width="100%">
								<tr>
									<td></td>
									<td><b>Topic</b></td>
									<td><b>Score</b></td>
									<td><b>1st Try</b></td>
									<td><b>2nd Try</b></td>
									<td><b>3rd Try</b></td>
								</tr>

									<td><textarea name="try_1st_2" class="newarea_width" rows="2"></textarea></td>
									<td><textarea name="try_2nd_2" class="newarea_width" rows="2"></textarea></td>
									<td><textarea name="try_3rd_2" class="newarea_width" rows="2"></textarea></td>
								</tr>
								<tr>
									<td>3.</td>
									<td><textarea name="topic_3" class="newarea_width" rows="2"></textarea></td>
									<td><textarea name="score_3" class="newarea_width" rows="2"></textarea></td>
									<td><textarea name="try_1st_3" class="newarea_width" rows="2"></textarea></td>
									<td><textarea name="try_2nd_3" class="newarea_width" rows="2"></textarea></td>
									<td><textarea name="try_3rd_3" class="newarea_width" rows="2"></textarea></td>
								</tr>
							</table>

							<h4><b>Exercise: I In this exercise we are using the universal ELEMENT OF ETHER (QUANTUM
									FIELD)</b></h4>
							<ol type="1">
								<li>This is going to be a written exercise. You can log into the portal and use the
									negative energy detox.</li>
								<img src="<?php echo base_url()." assets/images/a-6.jpg"?>" width="500px"/>
								<li>While writing down the memory, go deeper and deeper until you reach the root cause
									of this memory.</li>
								<li>See what your role was, what was happening around you, use all the five senses to
									bring out this memory.</li>
								<li>Become totally aware of your body and mind. See this incident or experience with
									your mind's eye and see it unfolding on you're the mental screen(Imagine you are
									sitting in a theatre and watching the screen and the experience is playing on the
									screen)</li>
								<li>Once you are totally aware and acknowledge your role in it, make a decision to let
									it go. </li>
								<li>Press the submit button and see it go off-poof it's out of your mind and into the
									quantum field where it dissipates. Ashes to ashes, dust to dust.</li>
								<li>Feel free and take three deep breaths and open your eyes.</li>
							</ol>


							<h4><b>Exercise II: In this exercise, we are using the universal Element of Water.</b></h4>

							<ol type="1">

								<li>In this exercise, you are going to go through a similar visualization but instead of
									using the portal you are going to use a paper & pen.</li>
								<li>Get comfortable and away from distractions. You can close your eyes and open them to
									write or you can go through the whole visualization and write at one time, whatever
									works for you.</li>
								<li>While writing down the memory, go deeper and deeper until you reach the root cause
									of this memory.</li>
								<li> MOST IMPORTANT PART HERE IS TO RECOGNISE WHAT PART OF THE BODY YOU ARE FEELING THE
									STAGNATED ENERGY.</li>
								<li>See what your role was, what was happening around you, use all the five senses to
									bring out this memory.</li>
								<li>Become totally aware of your body and mind. See this incident or experience with
									your mind's eye and see it unfolding on you're the mental screen( Imagine you are
									sitting in a theatre and watching the screen and the experience is playing on the
									screen)</li>
								<li>Once you are totally aware and acknowledge your role in it, and you have it written
									on a piece of paper, make a decision to let it go. </li>
								<li>Bring out the emotions that you want to let go of-fear anger or whatever it is, then
									physically tear the paper in pieces and flush it in the toilet.</li>
								<li>Hold on the flush handle while taking a deep breath and feeling the lightness of the
									energy bubble dissipate from the part of the body you recognized in the step # 4
								</li>

								<li>Experience the freedom and go back and write the score.</li>
							</ol>


							<h4><b>Exercise # 3 -- In this exercise, we are using the universal Element of Fire</b></h4>
							<ol type="1">

								<li>In this exercise, you are going to go through a similar visualization but instead of
									using the portal you are going to use a paper & pen.</li>
								<li>Get comfortable and away from distractions. You can close your eyes and open them to
									write or you can go through the whole visualization and write at one time, whatever
									works for you.</li>
								<li>While writing down the memory, go deeper and deeper until you reach the root cause
									of this memory.</li>
								<li>MOST IMPORTANT PART HERE IS TO RECOGNISE WHAT PART OF THE BODY YOU ARE FEELING THE
									STAGNATED ENERGY</li>
								<li>See what your role was, what was happening around you, use all the five senses to
									bring out this memory.</li>
								<li>Become totally aware of your body and mind. See this incident or experience with
									your mind's eye and see it unfolding on you-re the mental screen( Imagine you are
									sitting in a theatre and watching the screen and the experience is playing on the
									screen)</li>
								<li>Once you are totally aware and acknowledge your role in it, and you have it written
									on a piece of paper, make a decision to let it go. </li>
								<li>Bring out the emotions that you want to let go of-fear anger or whatever it is, then
									physically tear the paper in pieces and you will take it outside in an open space &
									burn it in a bowl or any vessel that will collect the ashes.</li>
								<li>You could take the ashes and flush it or scatter it in the grass. And while doing
									either take a deep breath and be aware - feeling the lightness of the energy bubble
									dissipate from the part of the body you recognized in the step # 4</li>
								<li>Experience the freedom and go back and write the score.</li>
							</ol>

							<h4><b>Exercise # 4 & 5 Element of earth & Wind</b></h4>
							<p>In this round, you could go through the same exercise- step 1 through step 7 and then you
								could dig the ground and bury the papers (Element of Earth) or you could burn the paper
								( Element of Wind-Air) --blow the ashes with the wind from a hill or a
								bridge.<br />Based on your zodiac the element that affects you most will be the one that
								will help you regain your powers over the memory.</p>

							<h3><b>Phase II - Anchoring the new Avatar.</b></h3>
							<h5>Now that we have released the fears and the conflicting belief and we have created space
								in the energy field; we are ready to install the new beliefs and anchor your new Avatar.
							</h5>

							Exercise: I
							<ol type="1">
								<li>Sit in a quiet and comfortable space.</li>
								<li>Close your eyes & relax your body.</li>
								<li>Take three deep breaths.</li>
								<li>Bring your focus to the center of the forehead.</li>
								<li>Visualize your new avatar giving the service or the product to your clients.</li>
								<li>Experience the joy and fulfillment of accomplishing that goal.</li>
								<li>Pay attention to the part of the body that feels the energy of that excitement.</li>
								<li>Decide on the Mudra/action (the hand gesture such as pumping your fist or holding on
									to a rock or another article that is associated with this action)</li>
								<li>Repeat the words (Mantra)-So Be IT - and open your eyes and release the vision into
									the quantum field so the energy can reach your clients or your client's energy can
									reach it - ( You are activating the LOA)</li>
							</ol>

							Exercise II:
							<p>After you have envisioned the experience in the above exercise, you need to train your
								body to feel the feelings. In this exercise, you are going to make a list of the goals.
								Be very clear about what you want to achieve and by what date. Write down the full
								experience in a piece of paper or you could log in the portal and use the Intention
								setter tool and release it in the field.</p>
							<img src="<?php echo base_url()." assets/images/a-6-intention.jpg"?>" width="500px"/>

							Exercise III:
							<p> For this step, it's critical that you very carefully choose one or two sincerely and
								highly supportive friends to share your new insights with. They must be truly supportive
								and willing to help you change. Often as we begin to make changes in our lives, whether
								business or personal, some of our most dearly loved friends and family can feel
								threatened by the process of change. While they may consciously want you to be
								successful, they may have their own subconscious conflicting
								intentions and be highly invested in wanting to maintain their own comfort zone by
								keeping you in yours. These are not the folks you want to ask for help from to do this
								exercise. Share the intentions and their conflicting counterparts with one or two others
								and ask your friends to help you in recognizing whether these are genuine concerns
								or unfounded fears. Then brainstorm ways to address the problems.</p>

							<p>In this exercise make a list of 5 people you are going to share the goals with. Provide
								them the milestones and the dates and why you want to achieve this goal. Tell them to
								use the "why" to motivate you when needed. The five people can include your family
								members, friends, peers, coaches or mentor. However, be very careful about whom you
								choose because you do not want their self-limiting beliefs or fears to come in your
								energy field. If they feel threatened by your success or they are not operating for
								their higher self it will defeat your purpose. In this case, you need to reach out to
								your coach or peer and if needed you can always ask us for support. In the space below
								write down the name and what kind of support they will provide. They must push you and
								encourage you to get out of your comfort zone.
							</p>

								<tr>
									<td><textarea name="people_1" class="newarea_width" rows="2"></textarea></td>

							<h4><b>A.6.11 Written Exercise: </b></h4>
							<p>Start with the basics. Keep it simple and straight for-ward. Refer to your target market
								from Chapter 2<br />
								The first time around, just come up with something accurate and clear for now - make
								sure an 8 - year - old can understand it. List as many possibilities as come to mind.
							</p>
							<ul>
								<li>What is your who and do what statement?</li>
								<li>Whom do you help and what do you help them do?</li>
							</ul>
							Finish this statement, "I help...."
							<p style="color:red">Example: I help ... transformational entrepreneurs build their coaching
								business. (Or, for the 8-year-old, " I help yoga teachers attract clients.")</p>

									<td><textarea name="statement_6" class="newarea_width" rows="2"></textarea></td>
									<td><textarea name="version_6" class="newarea_width" rows="2"></textarea></td>
								</tr>
							</table>

							<h4><b>A.6.12 Written Exercise:</b></h4>
							<p>Your mind keeps you in the comfort zone. It likes to have control, but now it's time to
								step out of your mind and jump into the quantum world. Let's make this real. Think BIG.
								I MEAN REALLY REALLY BIG. Don't let your mind filter anything. Be like a 5-year-old
								talking about being an astronaut or a pilot, he does not have a conflicting thought at
								all. Be creative, powerful and idealistic. Think of your higher self-perspective.
								Imagine you have Aladdin's lamp in your hand and will make your wishes come true. Be
								BOLD AND EXPRESS YOUR TRUE SELF.</p>

							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">What is your purpose? Why are you on this earth?</label>
								<textarea name="purpose" class="area_width" rows="3"></textarea>
								<span class="form-bar"></span>
							</div>
							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">What is your vision of what you hope to achieve through
									your work?</label>
								<textarea name="vision" class="area_width" rows="3"></textarea>
								<span class="form-bar"></span>
							</div>
							<h4><b>A.6.13 Written Exercise: </b></h4>
							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">Keeping the above in mind, craft a minimum of three
									possible why you do it statements.</label>
								<textarea name="possible_1" class="area_width" rows="3"></textarea>
								<textarea name="possible_2" class="area_width" rows="3"></textarea>
								<textarea name="possible_3" class="area_width" rows="3"></textarea>
								<span class="form-bar"></span>
							</div>

							<h4><b>A.6.14 Maanas Coaching Action Step: </b></h4>

							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">If your why you do it statement is not easily
									identifiable, email your friends & peers again and ask them to help you with some
									clarity. Quite often the thing that comes to us naturally is something we are not
									aware of. Things in plain sight sometimes elude us so have a third person give you
									their perspective. Jot down what you have found.</label><br />
								<textarea name="something" class="area_width" rows="3"></textarea>
								<span class="form-bar"></span>
							</div>

							<h4><b>A.6.15 Written Exercise </b></h4>

							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">Craft three to five possible taglines that represent and
									demonstrate your current favorite why you do it a statement.</label>
								<p style="color:red">Eg: The guy to take you beyond your mind. The guy to pull you in
									the flow.</p>

								<textarea name="tagline_1" class="area_width" rows="3"></textarea>
								<textarea name="tagline_2" class="area_width" rows="3"></textarea>
								<textarea name="tagline_3" class="area_width" rows="3"></textarea>
								<span class="form-bar"></span>
							</div>


							<div>
								<input type="submit" name="delete" class="btn btn-default" value="Clear Form">
								<a href="<?= base_url('coaching_session') ?>" class="btn btn-info">back</a>
								<input type="submit" name="submit" value="Submit" id="btnsubmit"
									class="btn btn-primary pull-right">
								<input type="submit" name="save" value="save" style="margin-right:20px"
									class="btn btn-info pull-right">
							</div>

						</div>
					</div>
				</div>
			</div>

		</form>
		<?php }} else {?>
		<a href="<?= base_url('coaching_session') ?>" class="btn btn-info">back</a>
		<!-- <div class="alert alert-danger col-md-6" role="alert">You have already submitted this form.</div> -->
		<?php } ?>
	</div>
</div>
<!-- END PAGE CONTENT WRAPPER -->

<script type="text/javascript" src="<?php echo base_url()." assets/";?>js / actions.js"></script>
<script>
	setTimeout(function () { notification(); }, 3000);

	function notification() {
		var user_id = "<?= $user_id ?>";
		var form_name = "the_transformation";
		$.get("<?= base_url('Member/delete_notification') ?>/" + user_id + "/" + form_name, "", function (response) {
			console.log(response);
		});
	}

	$(document).ready(function () {
		$('#btnsubmit').click(function () {
			$('#formsubmit').submit(function (event) {
				event.preventDefault();
				$.ajax({
					url: "<?= base_url("member/ the_transformation_form") ?>",
					type: "post",
					// dataType: "JSON",
					data: new FormData(this),
					processData: false,
					contentType: false,
					success: function (responce) {
					// console.log(responce);
					$('#formid').attr("href", "<?= base_url('member/marketingview/') ?>/the_transformation/" + responce);
					$("#download").attr("href", "<?= base_url('member/marketingdownload') ?>/the_transformation/" + responce);
					$("#reportview").modal('show');
				},
					error: function (xhr, desc, err) {


				}
            });
		});
	});
    });
</script>
<!-- END TEMPLATE -->
<?php
$this->load->view('member/footer');
?>

A-7 Creating The Know, Like & Trust Factor page controller

application/controllers/member.php 
public function creating_the_know_like_trust_factor()

{



//for email notification get admin and coach detail

$coach=$this->db->get_where('users',array('fld_id'=>$this->userid));

if ($coach->num_rows()>0) {

$row=$coach->row_array();



$coachName = $row["fld_username"] . " " . $row["fld_last_name"];

$coachemail = $row["fld_email"];

$coachsparent_id = $row["fld_parent"];

}



$admin=$this->db->get_where('users',array('fld_id'=>$coachsparent_id));

if ($admin->num_rows()>0) {

$row=$admin->row_array();



$adminName = $row["fld_username"] . " " . $row["fld_last_name"];

$adminemail = $row["fld_email"];

}



$row = array();

$successMsg = "";

$errorMsg = "";

$this->load->model('admin_model');

$tbForm = $this->admin_model->get_coaching_forms($this->userid,'creating_the_know_like_trust_factor');

if(sizeof($tbForm)>0){

$row = $tbForm[0];

}



if($this->input->post()){
if ($this->input->post('delete'))
{
$this->db->delete('user_trust_factor', array('fld_user_id' => $this->userid));
}
if (isset($_POST['save']))

{

$expert = $_POST['expert'];

$develop = $_POST['develop'];

$promise = $_POST['promise_1'];

$promise_2 = $_POST['promise_2'];

$promise_3 = $_POST['promise_3'];

$promise_4 = $_POST['promise_4'];

$promise_5 = $_POST['promise_5'];

$deliver = $_POST['deliver_1'];

$deliver_2 = $_POST['deliver_2'];

$deliver_3 = $_POST['deliver_3'];

$deliver_4 = $_POST['deliver_4'];

$deliver_5 = $_POST['deliver_5'];

$comfortable = $_POST['comfortable_1'];

$comfortable_2 = $_POST['comfortable_2'];

$comfortable_3 = $_POST['comfortable_3'];

$answers = $_POST['answers'];

$learn = $_POST['learn'];

$exercise = $_POST['exercise'];



$newData = array(

'expert' => $expert,

'develop' => $develop,

'promise' => $promise,

'promise_2' => $promise_2,

'promise_3' => $promise_3,

'promise_4' => $promise_4,

'promise_5' => $promise_5,

'deliver' => $deliver,

'deliver_2' => $deliver_2,

'deliver_3' => $deliver_3,

'deliver_4' => $deliver_4,

'deliver_5' => $deliver_5,

'comfortable' => $comfortable,

'comfortable_2' => $comfortable_2,

'comfortable_3' => $comfortable_3,

'answers' => $answers,

'learn' => $learn,

'exercise' => $exercise,

'fld_user_id' => $this->userid,

'fld_added_date' =>time(),

'fld_status' => 0,

);



$fill=$this->db->get_where('user_trust_factor',array('fld_user_id'=>$this->userid));

if ($fill->num_rows()>0)

{

$sql = "UPDATE `mys_user_trust_factor` SET
`fld_user_id`='$this->userid',`expert`='$expert',`develop`='$develop',`promise`='$promise',`promise_2`='$promise_2',`promise_3`='$promise_3',`promise_4`='$promise_4',`promise_5`='$promise_5',`deliver`='$deliver',`deliver_2`='$deliver_2',`deliver_3`='$deliver_3',`deliver_4`='$deliver_4',`deliver_5`='$deliver_5',`comfortable`='$comfortable',`comfortable_2`='$comfortable_2',`comfortable_3`='$comfortable_3',`answers`='$answers',`learn`='$learn',`exercise`='$exercise',`fld_added_date`='time()',`fld_status`='0'
WHERE `fld_user_id` = '$this->userid'";

// $this->db->where('fld_user_id',$this->userid);

// $query = $this->db->update('user_trust_factor',$newData);

$query = $this->db->query($sql);

if($query){

echo "<div class=\"alert alert-success\">Form save Successfully!<a href=\"#\" class=\"close\" data-dismiss=\"alert\"
		aria-label=\"close\">&times;</a></div>";

}

}else

{

$sql = "INSERT INTO `mys_user_trust_factor` ( `fld_user_id`, `expert`, `develop`, `promise`, `promise_2`, `promise_3`,
`promise_4`, `promise_5`, `deliver`, `deliver_2`, `deliver_3`, `deliver_4`, `deliver_5`, `comfortable`, `comfortable_2`,
`comfortable_3`, `answers`, `learn`, `exercise`, `fld_added_date`, `fld_status`) VALUES ( '$this->userid', '$expert',
'$develop', '$promise', '$promise_2', '$promise_3', '$promise_4', '$promise_5', '$deliver', '$deliver_2', '$deliver_3',
'$deliver_4', '$deliver_5', '$comfortable', '$comfortable_2', '$comfortable_3', '$answers', '$learn', '$exercise',
'time()', '0')";

$query = $this->db->query($sql);

// $query = $this->db->insert('user_trust_factor', $newData);

// $last_id = $this->db->insert_id();

if($query){

echo "<div class=\"alert alert-success\">Form save Successfully!<a href=\"#\" class=\"close\" data-dismiss=\"alert\"
		aria-label=\"close\">&times;</a></div>";

}

}

}

if(isset($_POST['submit'])){

$expert = $_POST['expert'];

$develop = $_POST['develop'];

$promise = '<br />1. '.$_POST['promise_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['promise_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['promise_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['promise_4'].'<br /><br />5. '.$_POST['promise_5'];

$deliver = '<br />1. '.$_POST['deliver_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['deliver_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['deliver_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['deliver_4'].'<br /><br />5. '.$_POST['deliver_5'];

$comfortable = '<br />1. '.$_POST['comfortable_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['comfortable_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['comfortable_3'];

$answers = $_POST['answers'];

$learn = $_POST['learn'];

$exercise = $_POST['exercise'];



$newData = array(

'expert' => $expert,

'develop' => $develop,

'promise' => $promise,

'deliver ' => $deliver,

'comfortable' => $comfortable,

'answers' => $answers,

'learn' => $learn,

'exercise' => $exercise,

'fld_user_id' => $this->userid,

'fld_added_date' =>time()

);

$query = $this->db->insert('trust_factor', $newData);

$last_id = $this->db->insert_id();

if($query){

$massage = "

<head>
	<meta http-equiv='Content-Type' content='text/html; charset=windows-1252'>
	<meta name='GENERATOR' content='MSHTML 11.00.10570.1001'>

<body bgcolor='#ffffff'><strong></strong><strong> </strong><strong></strong>
	<table width='600' align='center' id='TbHeader' bgcolor='#400080' border='0' cellspacing='0' cellpadding='4'>
		<tr>
			<td align='center' id='TdHeader' bgcolor='#400080'>
				<p align='center'>
					<font color='#ffffff' face='Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif' size='6'><strong>Welcome</strong></font>
				</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
	</table>
	<table width='600' align='center' id='TbBodyRow' border='0' cellspacing='0' cellpadding='0'>
		<tr>
			<td id='TdBodyRow' valign='top' bgcolor='#ffffff'>
				<table width='100%' id='TbBody' bgcolor='#ffffff' border='0' cellspacing='0' cellpadding='4'>
					<tr>
						<td align='center' id='TdBody' bgcolor='#ffffff'>
							&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<p align='left'>
								<font color='#000000' face='Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif' size='3'><strong>Hi
										".$adminName."&nbsp;<font color='#000000'
											face='Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif' size='3'>&nbsp;</font></strong>
								</font>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
							</p>
							<p align='justify' style='margin-right: 0px;'>
								<font color='#000000' face='Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif' size='3'>This is an
									auto-generated email to notify you that your client ".$coachName." has filled and
									submitted the form <b>\"A-7 Creating the know like & trust factor\"</b> on
									MyportalX.<br><br>Please check out your client reports on MyportalX.</font>
							</p><br></font>
							</font>
							</font>
							</p>
							<p align='left'><br></p>
						</td>
					</tr>
				</table>
			</td>
		</tr>
	</table><strong></strong><strong></strong><strong> </strong>
	<table width='600' align='center' id='TbFooter' bgcolor='#eea000' border='0' cellspacing='0' cellpadding='4'>
		<tr>
			<td align='center' id='TdFooter' bgcolor='#eea000'>
				<div style='margin: 0px; padding: 0px; text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 52, 89);'>
					<div style='margin: 0px; padding: 0px; text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 52, 89);'><span
							style='color: rgb(0, 52, 89); line-height: inherit; font-size: inherit; font-weight: bold; text-decoration: inherit;'><span
								style='color: rgb(0, 52, 89); line-height: inherit; font-family: arial; font-size: inherit; font-style: normal; font-weight: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;'><br></span></span>
					</div>
					<div style='margin: 0px; padding: 0px; text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 52, 89);'><span
							style='color: rgb(0, 52, 89); line-height: inherit; font-size: inherit; font-weight: bold; text-decoration: inherit;'><span
								style='color: rgb(0, 52, 89); line-height: inherit; font-family: arial; font-size: inherit; font-style: normal; font-weight: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;'>Regards,</span><br
								style='color: rgb(0, 52, 89);'></span></div>
					<div style='margin: 0px; padding: 0px; text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 52, 89);'><span
							style='color: rgb(0, 52, 89); line-height: inherit; font-family: arial; font-size: inherit; font-style: normal; font-weight: bold; text-decoration: inherit;'>Team
							MyportalX</span></div>
					<div style='margin: 0px; padding: 0px; text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 52, 89);'><span
							style='color: rgb(0, 52, 89); line-height: inherit; font-family: arial; font-size: inherit; font-style: normal; font-weight: bold; text-decoration: inherit;'><br></span>
					</div>
				</div>
			</td>
		</tr>
	</table>";

$subject = "Form Submitted";

$header = "From:" . $this->config->item('mail_from') . "\r\n";

$header .= "MIME-Version: 1.0\r\n";

$header .= "Content-type: text/html\r\n";

$retval = mail ($adminemail,$subject,$massage,$header);



$nots=array(

'sender_id' => $this->userid,

'reciver_id' => $coachsparent_id,

'message' => $coachName.", Filled-Up and submitted <b style='color:#4e73df'>\"Creating The Know, Like & Trust
	Factor\"</b> Form Today.",

'urls' => "mreport/".$this->userid,

'fld_date' => time()

);



$this->db->insert('notification',$nots);

echo "<div class=\"alert alert-success\">Form Submitted Successfully!<a href=\"#\" class=\"close\"
		data-dismiss=\"alert\" aria-label=\"close\">&times;</a></div>";

}



if($this->db->affected_rows()){

$updateData = array(

'completed_date' => time(),

'status' => "1",

'last_modified' => date('Y-m-d H:i:s')

);

$this->db->where(array('fld_form_id' => $row->id, 'fld_user_id' =>$this->userid));

$this->db->update('marketing_form_user',$updateData);

$successMsg = "Form Submitted Successfully!";



//get the updated row

$tbForm = $this->admin_model->get_coaching_forms($this->userid,'creating_the_know_like_trust_factor');

if(sizeof($tbForm)>0){

$row = $tbForm[0];

}

}

}

}

if($this->db->affected_rows()){

$insertFormPossition=array(

'fld_user_id' => $this->userid,

'fld_trust_factor' => '1'

//'fld_added_date' => time()

);

$userExist=$this->Common_model->user_exist_form_possition($this->userid);

if($userExist){

$this->db->where('fld_user_id',$this->userid);

$this->db->update('form_possition',$insertFormPossition);

}else{

$this->db->insert('form_possition',$insertFormPossition);

}

}else{

echo "Database Error.";

}

$data = array("Form" => $row,

"Error_Message" => $errorMsg,

"Success_Message" => $successMsg

);



$this->load->view('member/creating_the_know_like_trust_factor', $data);

}

A-7 Creating The Know, Like & Trust Factor page View

application/views/member/creating_the_know_like_trust_factor.php 
<?php
$this->load->view('member/sidebar');
$session= $this->session->get_userdata();
$user_id=$session['user_id'];
 $completed="";
error_reporting(0);

$user=$this->db->get_where('users',array('fld_id'=>$user_id));
        if ($user->num_rows()>0) {
        $row=$user->row_array();

        $memberName = $row["fld_first_name"] . " " . $row["fld_last_name"];
        $memberemail = $row["fld_email"];
        $membersparent_id = $row["fld_parent"];
        }

        $coach=$this->db->get_where('users',array('fld_id'=>$membersparent_id));
        if ($coach->num_rows()>0) {
        $row=$coach->row_array();

        $coachName = $row["fld_first_name"] . " " . $row["fld_last_name"];
        $coachemail = $row["fld_email"];
        }
?>


<!-- START BREADCRUMB -->
<ul class="breadcrumb">
	<li><a href="<?php echo base_url()." member"?>">Home</a></li>
	<li class="active"><a href="">Marketing Client</a></li>
</ul>
<!-- END BREADCRUMB -->
<img src="<?php echo base_url()." assets/images/marketing.jpg"?>" width="100%"/>
<!-- PAGE CONTENT WRAPPER -->
<div class="page-content-wrap">

	<!-- PAGE TITLE -->
	<div class="page-title">
		<h2 style="color:#006600">A-7 Creating The Know, Like & Trust Factor</h2>
	</div>
	<!-- END PAGE TITLE -->
	<div class="page-content-wrap">
		<?php if ($Form->completed_date == ""){
                        $fill=$this->db->get_where('user_trust_factor',array('fld_user_id'=>$user_id));
            if ($fill->num_rows()>0) 
            { 
                $row=$fill->row_array();
                        ?>
		<form action="#" role="form" id="formsubmit" class="form-horizontal form-material" method="post">
			<div class="row">
				<div class="col-md-12">
					<div class="panel panel-default">
						<div class="panel-body">
							<h2 style="color:red">Know, Like & Trust Factor</h2>
							<p>In this module, you'll develop a strategy for creating trust and credibility so that you
								can stand out from the crowd and begin to build relationships with your potential
								clients. Your strategy will be based on:</p>
							<ul>
								<li>Becoming and establishing yourself as a likable expert in your field</li>
								<li>Building relationships of trust over time through your sales cycle</li>
								<li>Developing brand-building products and programs</li>
								<li>You'll begin looking at what you have to do, be, and create to begin reaching out to
									those you're meant to serve.</li>
								<li>The lessons in Module II will lead you through the process and you'll</li>
								<li>begin to really see that marketing and sales don't have to be so hard after all. In
									fact, I think you'll find that it can even be exciting and fun.</li>
							</ul><br />

							<h4><b>Who Knows What You Know and Do They Like You?</b></h4>
							<h5>Establish yourself as a category authority-a well-known, well-liked expert in your
								field.</h5>
							<h4><b>A.7.1 Written Exercise:</b></h4>


							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">Please answer the following questions:<br />
									1. In what areas are you currently an expert?</label><br />
								<textarea name="expert" class="area_width" rows="3"><?= $row['expert'] ?></textarea>
								<span class="form-bar"></span>
							</div>
							<h4><b>Part II </b></h4>
							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">In what areas do you need to develop your
									expertise?</label>
								<textarea name="develop" class="area_width" rows="3"><?= $row['develop'] ?></textarea>
								<span class="form-bar"></span>
							</div>
							<h4><b>problem_III</b></h4>
							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">What are the top 5 promises you can make and deliver to
									your target market that will position you as an expert?</label>
								<table width="100%">
									<tr>
										<td style="width:100px">1.</td>
										<td><textarea name="promise_1" class="newarea_width"
												rows="2"><?= $row['promise'] ?></textarea></td>
									</tr>
									<tr>
										<td>2.</td>
										<td><textarea name="promise_2" class="newarea_width"
												rows="2"><?= $row['promise_2'] ?></textarea></td>
									</tr>
									<tr>
										<td>3.</td>
										<td><textarea name="promise_3" class="newarea_width"
												rows="2"><?= $row['promise_3'] ?></textarea></td>
									</tr>
									<tr>
										<td>4.</td>
										<td><textarea name="promise_4" class="newarea_width"
												rows="2"><?= $row['promise_4'] ?></textarea></td>
									</tr>
									<tr>
										<td>5.</td>
										<td><textarea name="promise_5" class="newarea_width"
												rows="2"><?= $row['promise_5'] ?></textarea></td>
									</tr>
								</table>
								<span class="form-bar"></span>
							</div>

							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">What other 5 promises would you like to make and deliver
									to your target market but don't yet feel comfortable with?</label>
								<table width="100%">
									<tr>
										<td style="width:100px">1.</td>
										<td><textarea name="deliver_1" class="area_width"
												rows="3"><?= $row['deliver'] ?></textarea></td>
									</tr>
									<tr>
										<td>2.</td>
										<td><textarea name="deliver_2" class="area_width"

									</tr>

										<td>3.</td>

								</table>

							</div>


							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">What are the top 3 things you need to do to become
									comfortable with making and delivering these promises?</label>
								<table width="100%">
									<tr>
										<td style="width:100px">1.</td>
										<td><textarea name="comfortable_1" class="area_width"
												rows="3"><?= $row['comfortable'] ?></textarea></td>
									</tr>
									<tr>
										<td>2.</td>
										<td><textarea name="comfortable_2" class="area_width"
												rows="3"><?= $row['comfortable_2'] ?></textarea></td>
									</tr>
									<tr>
										<td>3.</td>
										<td><textarea name="comfortable_3" class="area_width"
												rows="3"><?= $row['comfortable_3'] ?></textarea></td>
									</tr>
								</table>
								<span class="form-bar"></span>
							</div>
							<h4><b>A.7.2 Written Exercise:</b> </h4>

							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">Keeping the answers from the previously written exercise
									in mind, if there was one thing you could be known for within your target market,
									what would it be?</label><br>
								<textarea name="answers" class="area_width" rows="3"><?= $row['answers'] ?></textarea>
								<span class="form-bar"></span>
							</div>

							<h4><b>A.7.3 Written Exercise:</b></h4>
							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">What do you need to learn to become a category
									author-city in the area you'd like to be known for?
								</label>
								<textarea name="learn" class="area_width" rows="3"><?= $row['learn'] ?></textarea>
								<span class="form-bar"></span>
							</div>
							<h4><b>A.7.4 Written Exercise:</b></h4>
							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">List the ways in which you could learn the things you
									identified in the preceding written exercise
								</label>
								<textarea name="exercise" class="area_width" rows="3"><?= $row['exercise'] ?></textarea>
								<p style="color:red"><b>Example:</b> Books, Internet research, training programs,
									apprenticing with a mentor who is already a category authority?</p>

							</div>

							<div>
								<input type="submit" name="delete" class="btn btn-default" value="Clear Form">
								<a href="<?= base_url('coaching_session') ?>" class="btn btn-info">back</a>
								<input type="submit" name="submit" value="Submit" id="btnsubmit"
									class="btn btn-primary pull-right">
								<input type="submit" name="save" value="save" style="margin-right:20px"
									class="btn btn-info pull-right">
							</div>

						</div>
					</div>
				</div>
			</div>

		</form>
		<?php }else{ ?>
		<form action="#" role="form" id="formsubmit" class="form-horizontal form-material" method="post">
			<div class="row">
				<div class="col-md-12">
					<div class="panel panel-default">
						<div class="panel-body">
							<h2 style="color:red">Know, Like & Trust Factor</h2>
							<p>In this module, you'll develop a strategy for creating trust and credibility so that you
								can stand out from the crowd and begin to build relationships with your potential
								clients. Your strategy will be based on:</p>
							<ul>
								<li>Becoming and establishing yourself as a likable expert in your field</li>
								<li>Building relationships of trust over time through your sales cycle</li>
								<li>Developing brand-building products and programs</li>
								<li>You'll begin looking at what you have to do, be, and create to begin reaching out to
									those you're meant to serve.</li>
								<li>The lessons in Module II will lead you through the process and you'll</li>
								<li>begin to really see that marketing and sales don't have to be so hard after all. In
									fact, I think you'll find that it can even be exciting and fun.</li>
							</ul><br />

<!-- Modal HTML -->
<div id="reportview" class="modal fade" tabindex="-1">
	<div class="modal-dialog">
		<div class="modal-content">
			<div class="modal-header">
				<h5 class="modal-title">Your Form Was Successfully Submitted!</h5>
				<!--<button type="button" class="close" data-dismiss="modal">&times;</button>-->
			</div>
			<div class="modal-body">
				<!--<input type="text" id="formid">-->
				<div class="text-center">
					<a href="" target="_blank" id="formid" class="btn btn-info">View</a>
					<a href="" target="_blank" id="download" class="btn btn-warning">Save</a>
				</div>
			</div>
			<div class="modal-footer">
				<button type="button" class="btn btn-secondary" data-dismiss="modal">Cancel</button>
				<!--<button type="button" class="btn btn-primary">Save</button>-->
			</div>
		</div>
	</div>
</div>
<script>
	setTimeout(function () { notification(); }, 3000);

	function notification() {
		var user_id = "<?= $user_id ?>";
		var form_name = "creating_the_know_like_trust_factor";
		$.get("<?= base_url('Member/delete_notification') ?>/" + user_id + "/" + form_name, "", function (response) {
			console.log(response);
		});
	}

	$(document).ready(function () {
		$('#btnsubmit').click(function () {
			$('#formsubmit').submit(function (event) {
				event.preventDefault();
				$.ajax({
					url: "<?= base_url("member/ creating_the_know_like_trust_factor_form") ?>",
					type: "post",
					// dataType: "JSON",
					data: new FormData(this),
					processData: false,
					contentType: false,
					success: function (responce) {
					// console.log(responce);
					$('#formid').attr("href", "<?= base_url('member/marketingview/') ?>/trust_factor/" + responce);
					$("#download").attr("href", "<?= base_url('member/marketingdownload') ?>/trust_factor/" + responce);
					$("#reportview").modal('show');
				},
					error: function (xhr, desc, err) {


				}
            });
		});
	});
    });
</script>
<!-- START SCRIPTS -->

<?php
$this->load->view('member/footer');
?>

A-8 Product Creation page controller

application/controllers/member.php 
public function product_creation()

{



//for email notification get admin and coach detail

$coach=$this->db->get_where('users',array('fld_id'=>$this->userid));

if ($coach->num_rows()>0) {

$row=$coach->row_array();



$coachName = $row["fld_username"] . " " . $row["fld_last_name"];

$coachemail = $row["fld_email"];

$coachsparent_id = $row["fld_parent"];

}



$admin=$this->db->get_where('users',array('fld_id'=>$coachsparent_id));

if ($admin->num_rows()>0) {

$row=$admin->row_array();



$adminName = $row["fld_username"] . " " . $row["fld_last_name"];

$adminemail = $row["fld_email"];

}

$row = array();

$successMsg = "";

$errorMsg = "";

$this->load->model('admin_model');

$tbForm = $this->admin_model->get_coaching_forms($this->userid,'product_creation');

if(sizeof($tbForm)>0){

$row = $tbForm[0];

}



if($this->input->post()){
if ($this->input->post('delete'))
{
$this->db->delete('user_product_creation', array('fld_user_id' => $this->userid));
}
if (isset($_POST['save']))

{

$product = $_POST['product'];

$passionate = $_POST['passionate'];

$offering = $_POST['offering'];

$target = $_POST['target'];

$feel = $_POST['feel'];

$variety = $_POST['variety'];

$market = $_POST['market'];

$need = $_POST['need'];

$different = $_POST['different'];

$appeals = $_POST['appeals'];

$framework = $_POST['framework'];

$step = $_POST['step_1'];

$step_2 = $_POST['step_2'];

$step_3 = $_POST['step_3'];

$step_4 = $_POST['step_4'];

$step_5 = $_POST['step_5'];

$step_6 = $_POST['step_6'];

$step_7 = $_POST['step_7'];

$service = $_POST['service_1'];

$service_2 = $_POST['service_2'];

$service_3 = $_POST['service_3'];

$service_4 = $_POST['service_4'];

$service_5 = $_POST['service_5'];

$problem = $_POST['problem_1'];

$problem_2 = $_POST['problem_2'];

$problem_3 = $_POST['problem_3'];

$problem_4 = $_POST['problem_4'];

$problem_5 = $_POST['problem_5'];

$benefit = $_POST['benefit_1'];

$benefit_2 = $_POST['benefit_2'];

$benefit_3 = $_POST['benefit_3'];

$benefit_4 = $_POST['benefit_4'];

$benefit_5 = $_POST['benefit_5'];

$care = $_POST['care_1'];

$care_2 = $_POST['care_2'];

$care_3 = $_POST['care_3'];

$care_4 = $_POST['care_4'];

$care_5 = $_POST['care_5'];

$ultimate = $_POST['ultimate_1'];

$ultimate_2 = $_POST['ultimate_2'];

$ultimate_3 = $_POST['ultimate_3'];

$ultimate_4 = $_POST['ultimate_4'];

$ultimate_5 = $_POST['ultimate_5'];





$newData = array(

'product' => $product,

'passionate' => $passionate,

'offering' => $offering,

'target ' => $target,

'feel' => $feel,

'variety' => $variety,

'market' => $market,

'need' => $need,

'different' => $different,

'appeals' => $appeals,

'framework' => $framework,

'step' => $step,

'step_2' => $step_2,

'step_3' => $step_3,

'step_4' => $step_4,

'step_5' => $step_5,

'step_6' => $step_6,

'step_7' => $step_7,

'service' => $service,

'problem' => $problem,

'benefit' => $benefit,

'care' => $care,

'ultimate' => $ultimate,

'service_2' => $service_2,

'problem_2' => $problem_2,

'benefit_2' => $benefit_2,

'care_2' => $care_2,

'ultimate_2' => $ultimate_2,

'service_3' => $service_3,

'problem_3' => $problem_3,

'benefit_3' => $benefit_3,

'care_3' => $care_3,

'ultimate_3' => $ultimate_3,

'service_4' => $service_4,

'problem_4' => $problem_4,

'benefit_4' => $benefit_4,

'care_4' => $care_4,

'ultimate_4' => $ultimate_4,

'service_5' => $service_5,

'problem_5' => $problem_5,

'benefit_5' => $benefit_5,

'care_5' => $care_5,

'ultimate_5' => $ultimate_5,

'fld_user_id' => $this->userid,

'fld_added_date' =>time()

);

$fill=$this->db->get_where('user_product_creation',array('fld_user_id'=>$this->userid));

if ($fill->num_rows()>0)

{

$this->db->where('fld_user_id',$this->userid);

$query = $this->db->update('user_product_creation',$newData);

if($query){

echo "<div class=\"alert alert-success\">Form save Successfully!<a href=\"#\" class=\"close\" data-dismiss=\"alert\"
		aria-label=\"close\">&times;</a></div>";

}

}else

{

$query = $this->db->insert('user_product_creation', $newData);

$last_id = $this->db->insert_id();

if($query){

echo "<div class=\"alert alert-success\">Form save Successfully!<a href=\"#\" class=\"close\" data-dismiss=\"alert\"
		aria-label=\"close\">&times;</a></div>";

}

}



}

if(isset($_POST['submit'])){

$product = $_POST['product'];

$passionate = $_POST['passionate'];

$offering = $_POST['offering'];

$target = $_POST['target'];

$feel = $_POST['feel'];

$variety = $_POST['variety'];

$market = $_POST['market'];

$need = $_POST['need'];

$different = $_POST['different'];

$appeals = $_POST['appeals'];

$framework = $_POST['framework'];

$step = '<br />1. '.$_POST['step_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['step_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['step_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['step_4'].'<br /><br />5. '.$_POST['step_5'].'<br /><br />6.
'.$_POST['step_6'].'<br /><br />7. '.$_POST['step_7'];

$service = '<br />1. '.$_POST['service_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['service_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['service_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['service_4'].'<br /><br />5. '.$_POST['service_5'];

$problem = '<br />1. '.$_POST['problem_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['problem_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['problem_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['problem_4'].'<br /><br />5. '.$_POST['problem_5'];

$benefit = '<br />1. '.$_POST['benefit_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['benefit_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['benefit_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['benefit_4'].'<br /><br />5. '.$_POST['benefit_5'];

$care = '<br />1. '.$_POST['care_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['care_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['care_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['care_4'].'<br /><br />5. '.$_POST['care_5'];

$ultimate = '<br />1. '.$_POST['ultimate_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['ultimate_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['ultimate_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['ultimate_4'].'<br /><br />5. '.$_POST['ultimate_5'];





$newData = array(

'product' => $product,

'passionate' => $passionate,

'offering' => $offering,

'target ' => $target,

'feel' => $feel,

'variety' => $variety,

'market' => $market,

'need' => $need,

'different' => $different,

'appeals' => $appeals,

'framework' => $framework,

'step' => $step,

'service' => $service,

'problem' => $problem,

'benefit' => $benefit,

'care' => $care,

'ultimate' => $ultimate,

'fld_user_id' => $this->userid,

'fld_added_date' =>time()

);

$query = $this->db->insert('product_creation', $newData);

$last_id = $this->db->insert_id();

if($query){

$massage = "

<head>
	<meta http-equiv='Content-Type' content='text/html; charset=windows-1252'>
	<meta name='GENERATOR' content='MSHTML 11.00.10570.1001'>

<body bgcolor='#ffffff'><strong></strong><strong> </strong><strong></strong>
	<table width='600' align='center' id='TbHeader' bgcolor='#400080' border='0' cellspacing='0' cellpadding='4'>
		<tr>
			<td align='center' id='TdHeader' bgcolor='#400080'>
				<p align='center'>
					<font color='#ffffff' face='Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif' size='6'><strong>Welcome</strong></font>
				</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
	</table>
	<table width='600' align='center' id='TbBodyRow' border='0' cellspacing='0' cellpadding='0'>
		<tr>
			<td id='TdBodyRow' valign='top' bgcolor='#ffffff'>
				<table width='100%' id='TbBody' bgcolor='#ffffff' border='0' cellspacing='0' cellpadding='4'>
					<tr>
						<td align='center' id='TdBody' bgcolor='#ffffff'>

										".$adminName."&nbsp;<font color='#000000'
											face='Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif' size='3'>&nbsp;</font></strong>
								</font>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
							</p>

									auto-generated email to notify you that your client ".$coachName." has filled and
									submitted the form <b>\"A-8 Product creation\"</b> on MyportalX.<br><br>Please check
									out your client reports on MyportalX.</font>
							</p><br></font>
							</font>
							</font>
							</p>
							<p align='left'><br></p>
						</td>
					</tr>
				</table>
			</td>
		</tr>
	</table><strong></strong><strong></strong><strong> </strong>
	<table width='600' align='center' id='TbFooter' bgcolor='#eea000' border='0' cellspacing='0' cellpadding='4'>
		<tr>
			<td align='center' id='TdFooter' bgcolor='#eea000'>
				<div style='margin: 0px; padding: 0px; text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 52, 89);'>
					<div style='margin: 0px; padding: 0px; text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 52, 89);'><span
							style='color: rgb(0, 52, 89); line-height: inherit; font-size: inherit; font-weight: bold; text-decoration: inherit;'><span
								style='color: rgb(0, 52, 89); line-height: inherit; font-family: arial; font-size: inherit; font-style: normal; font-weight: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;'><br></span></span>
					</div>
					<div style='margin: 0px; padding: 0px; text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 52, 89);'><span
							style='color: rgb(0, 52, 89); line-height: inherit; font-size: inherit; font-weight: bold; text-decoration: inherit;'><span
								style='color: rgb(0, 52, 89); line-height: inherit; font-family: arial; font-size: inherit; font-style: normal; font-weight: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;'>Regards,</span><br
								style='color: rgb(0, 52, 89);'></span></div>
					<div style='margin: 0px; padding: 0px; text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 52, 89);'><span
							style='color: rgb(0, 52, 89); line-height: inherit; font-family: arial; font-size: inherit; font-style: normal; font-weight: bold; text-decoration: inherit;'>Team
							MyportalX</span></div>
					<div style='margin: 0px; padding: 0px; text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 52, 89);'><span
							style='color: rgb(0, 52, 89); line-height: inherit; font-family: arial; font-size: inherit; font-style: normal; font-weight: bold; text-decoration: inherit;'><br></span>
					</div>
				</div>
			</td>
		</tr>
	</table>
";

$subject = "Form Submitted";

$header = "From:" . $this->config->item('mail_from') . "\r\n";

$header .= "MIME-Version: 1.0\r\n";

$header .= "Content-type: text/html\r\n";

$retval = mail ($adminemail,$subject,$massage,$header);



$nots=array(

'sender_id' => $this->userid,

'reciver_id' => $coachsparent_id,

'message' => $coachName.", Filled-Up and submitted <b style='color:#4e73df'>\"Product Creation\"</b> Form Today.",

'urls' => "mreport/".$this->userid,

'fld_date' => time()

);



$this->db->insert('notification',$nots);



echo "<div class=\"alert alert-success\">Form Submitted Successfully!<a href=\"#\" class=\"close\"
		data-dismiss=\"alert\" aria-label=\"close\">&times;</a></div>";

}



if($this->db->affected_rows()){

$updateData = array(

'completed_date' => time(),

'status' => "1",

'last_modified' => date('Y-m-d H:i:s')

);

$this->db->where(array('fld_form_id' => $row->id, 'fld_user_id' =>$this->userid));

$this->db->update('marketing_form_user',$updateData);

$successMsg = "Form Submitted Successfully!";



//get the updated row

$tbForm = $this->admin_model->get_coaching_forms($this->userid,'product_creation');

if(sizeof($tbForm)>0){

$row = $tbForm[0];

}

}

}

}

if($this->db->affected_rows()){

$insertFormPossition=array(

'fld_user_id' => $this->userid,

'fld_product_creation' => '1'

//'fld_added_date' => time()

);

$userExist=$this->Common_model->user_exist_form_possition($this->userid);

if($userExist){

$this->db->where('fld_user_id',$this->userid);

$this->db->update('form_possition',$insertFormPossition);

}else{

$this->db->insert('form_possition',$insertFormPossition);

}

}else{

echo "Database Error.";

}

$data = array("Form" => $row,

"Error_Message" => $errorMsg,

"Success_Message" => $successMsg

);



$this->load->view('member/product_creation', $data);

}

A-8 Product Creation page View

application/views/member/product_creation.php 
<?php
$this->load->view('member/sidebar');
$session= $this->session->get_userdata();
$user_id=$session['user_id'];
 $completed="";
error_reporting(0);

$user=$this->db->get_where('users',array('fld_id'=>$user_id));
        if ($user->num_rows()>0) {
        $row=$user->row_array();

        $memberName = $row["fld_first_name"] . " " . $row["fld_last_name"];
        $memberemail = $row["fld_email"];
        $membersparent_id = $row["fld_parent"];
        }

        $coach=$this->db->get_where('users',array('fld_id'=>$membersparent_id));
        if ($coach->num_rows()>0) {
        $row=$coach->row_array();

        $coachName = $row["fld_first_name"] . " " . $row["fld_last_name"];
        $coachemail = $row["fld_email"];
        }
?>


<!-- START BREADCRUMB -->
<ul class="breadcrumb">
	<li><a href="<?php echo base_url()." member"?>">Home</a></li>
	<li class="active"><a href="">Marketing Client</a></li>
</ul>
<!-- END BREADCRUMB -->
<img src="<?php echo base_url()." assets/images/marketing.jpg"?>" width="100%"/>
<!-- PAGE CONTENT WRAPPER -->
<div class="page-content-wrap">

	<!-- PAGE TITLE -->
	<div class="page-title">
		<h2 style="color:#006600">A-8 Product Creation</h2>
	</div>
	<!-- END PAGE TITLE -->
	<div class="page-content-wrap">
		<?php if ($Form->completed_date == ""){
                    	$fill=$this->db->get_where('user_product_creation',array('fld_user_id'=>$user_id));
            if ($fill->num_rows()>0)

                $row=$fill->row_array();

					<div class="panel panel-default">
						<div class="panel-body">
							<h2 style="color:red">Product Creation Questions</h2>
							<p>The Power of Information Products Design a product or program that fits who you are and
								appeals to your ideal clients.</p>
							<h4><b>A.8.1 Written Exercise: </b></h4>
							<h5>For now, keep it simple. Just get your ideas out of your head and into your journal</h5>


							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">1. What type of product or program would you most like
									to create?</label>

									rows="2"><?=$row['offering'] ?></textarea>
							</div>

								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">4. What benefits will your target market experience as a
									result of your product?</label>

							</div>
							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">5. How do you want your product to look and feel? What
									image or emotion do you want it to convey?</label>
								<textarea name="feel" class="newarea_width" rows="2"><?= $row['feel'] ?></textarea>
							</div>

							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">6. How might you leverage the same content into a
									variety of different formats and price points for your sales cycle?</label>
								<textarea name="variety" class="newarea_width"
									rows="2"><?= $row['variety'] ?></textarea>
							</div>
							<h4><b>A.8.2 Written Exercise: </b></h4>
							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">Answer the following questions:<br /> Why does your
									target market need your particular product now?</label><br />
								<textarea name="market" class="area_width" rows="3"><?= $row['market'] ?></textarea>
								<span class="form-bar"></span>
							</div>

							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">What does your product need to deliver for it to meet
									your customer's need?</label>
								<textarea name="need" class="newarea_width" rows="2"><?= $row['need'] ?></textarea>
							</div>
							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">What about your product, if anything, will be different
									from similar products on the market?</label>
								<textarea name="different" class="newarea_width"
									rows="2"><?= $row['different'] ?></textarea>
							</div>

							<p style="color:red">Bonus: How can you overdeliver on your promises by adding unexpected
								value to make your product remarkable? If you're unsure of your target market's need for
								a particular type of product or program, doing market research will help you ensure
								you're creating something your target market will find valuable. Survey friends,
								clients, and groups, such as online discussion groups or local organizations. And
								certainly search Google, using keywords that your target audience would use. It's the
								best research tool out there.</p>

							<h4><b>A.8.3 Written Exercise:</b> </h4>
							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">Which role most appeals to you or is most appropriate to

									<option <?php if ($row['framework']=='5' ) { echo "selected" ; } ?>>5</option>

									<option <?php if ($row['framework']=='7' ) { echo "selected" ; } ?>>7</option>
									<option <?php if ($row['framework']=='8' ) { echo "selected" ; } ?>>8</option>
									<option <?php if ($row['framework']=='9' ) { echo "selected" ; } ?>>9</option>
									<option <?php if ($row['framework']=='10' ) { echo "selected" ; } ?>>10</option>
								</select>

							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">3. To whom would you be offering this product? (Refer to
									target market.)</label>
								<textarea name="offering" class="newarea_width" rows="2"></textarea>
							</div>

							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">4. What benefits will your target market experience as a
									result of your product?</label>
								<textarea name="target" class="newarea_width" rows="2"></textarea>
							</div>
							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">5. How do you want your product to look and feel? What
									image or emotion do you want it to convey?</label>
								<textarea name="feel" class="newarea_width" rows="2"></textarea>
							</div>

							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">6. How might you leverage the same content into a
									variety of different formats and price points for your sales cycle?</label>
								<textarea name="variety" class="newarea_width" rows="2"></textarea>
							</div>
							<h4><b>A.8.2 Written Exercise: </b></h4>
							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">Answer the following questions:<br /> Why does your
									target market need your particular product now?</label><br />
								<textarea name="market" class="area_width" rows="3"></textarea>
								<span class="form-bar"></span>
							</div>

							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">What does your product need to deliver for it to meet
									your customer's need?</label>
								<textarea name="need" class="newarea_width" rows="2"></textarea>
							</div>
							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">What about your product, if anything, will be different
									from similar products on the market?</label>
								<textarea name="different" class="newarea_width" rows="2"></textarea>
							</div>

							<p style="color:red">Bonus: How can you overdeliver on your promises by adding unexpected
								value to make your product remarkable? If you're unsure of your target market's need for
								a particular type of product or program, doing market research will help you ensure
								you're creating something your target market will find valuable. Survey friends,
								clients, and groups, such as online discussion groups or local organizations. And
								certainly search Google, using keywords that your target audience would use. It's the
								best research tool out there.</p>

							<h4><b>A.8.3 Written Exercise:</b> </h4>
							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">Which role most appeals to you or is most appropriate to
									your product or program, and why?</label>
								<textarea name="appeals" class="newarea_width" rows="2"></textarea>
							</div>
							<h4><b>A.8.4 Written Exercise:</b> </h4>


							<div class="form-group">
								<label for="exampleInputEmail1">Which framework will you choose and why? : Choose one of
									the title types that fit your product or that</label><br>
								<select name="framework" class="myform-control" required>
									<option value="">-- Select --</option>
									<option>1</option>
									<option>2</option>
									<option>3</option>
									<option>4</option>
									<option>5</option>
									<option>6</option>
									<option>7</option>
									<option>8</option>
									<option>9</option>
									<option>10</option>
								</select>

							</div>
							<h4>A.8.5 Written Exercise:</h4>
							<p>you find especially appealing, and brainstorm a number of different title ideas. Have fun
								with this. Just get your creative juices flowing.</p>
							<hr />
							<h4>A.8.6 Written Exercise</h4>
							<h5>Create your table of contents. Keep the following questions in mind:</h5>
							<div class="form-group">
								<ul>
									<li>What are the steps to understanding your content?</li>
									<li>Is the flow logical and easy to understand?</li>
								</ul>
								<table width="100%">
									<tr>
										<td>Chapter #</td>
										<td>Chapter / Module Title ( name)</td>
									<tr>
									<tr>
										<td style="width:100px">1.</td>
										<td><textarea name="step_1" class="newarea_width" rows="2"></textarea></td>
									</tr>
									<tr>

									</tr>

									</tr>

									</tr>

							</div>

<!-- Modal HTML -->
<div id="reportview" class="modal fade" tabindex="-1">
	<div class="modal-dialog">
		<div class="modal-content">
			<div class="modal-header">
				<h5 class="modal-title">Your Form Was Successfully Submitted!</h5>
				<!--<button type="button" class="close" data-dismiss="modal">&times;</button>-->
			</div>
			<div class="modal-body">
				<!--<input type="text" id="formid">-->
				<div class="text-center">
					<a href="" target="_blank" id="formid" class="btn btn-info">View</a>
					<a href="" target="_blank" id="download" class="btn btn-warning">Save</a>
				</div>
			</div>
			<div class="modal-footer">
				<button type="button" class="btn btn-secondary" data-dismiss="modal">Cancel</button>
				<!--<button type="button" class="btn btn-primary">Save</button>-->
			</div>
		</div>
	</div>
</div>
<script>
	setTimeout(function () { notification(); }, 3000);

	function notification() {
		var user_id = "<?= $user_id ?>";
		var form_name = "product_creation";
		$.get("<?= base_url('Member/delete_notification') ?>/" + user_id + "/" + form_name, "", function (response) {
			console.log(response);
		});
	}

	$(document).ready(function () {
		$('#btnsubmit').click(function () {
			$('#formsubmit').submit(function (event) {
				event.preventDefault();
				$.ajax({
					url: "<?= base_url("member/ product_creation_form") ?>",
					type: "post",
					// dataType: "JSON",
					data: new FormData(this),
					processData: false,
					contentType: false,
					success: function (responce) {
					// console.log(responce);
					$('#formid').attr("href", "<?= base_url('member/marketingview/product_creation/') ?>/" + responce);
					$("#download").attr("href", "<?= base_url('member/marketingdownload/product_creation/') ?>/" + responce);
					$("#reportview").modal('show');
				},
					error: function (xhr, desc, err) {


				}
            });
		});
	});
    });
</script>
<!-- START SCRIPTS -->

A-9 Perfect Pricing & Simple Selling page Controller

application/controllers/member.php 
public function perfect_pricing()

{

//for email notification get admin and coach detail

$coach=$this->db->get_where('users',array('fld_id'=>$this->userid));

if ($coach->num_rows()>0) {

$row=$coach->row_array();



$coachName = $row["fld_username"] . " " . $row["fld_last_name"];

$coachemail = $row["fld_email"];

$coachsparent_id = $row["fld_parent"];

}



$admin=$this->db->get_where('users',array('fld_id'=>$coachsparent_id));

if ($admin->num_rows()>0) {

$row=$admin->row_array();



$adminName = $row["fld_username"] . " " . $row["fld_last_name"];

$adminemail = $row["fld_email"];

}



$row = array();

$successMsg = "";

$errorMsg = "";

$this->load->model('admin_model');

$tbForm = $this->admin_model->get_coaching_forms($this->userid,'perfect_pricing');

if(sizeof($tbForm)>0){

$row = $tbForm[0];

}



if($this->input->post()){
if ($this->input->post('delete'))
{
$this->db->delete('user_perfect_pricing', array('fld_user_id' => $this->userid));
}
if (isset($_POST['save']))

{

$client = $_POST['client_1'];

$client_2 = $_POST['client_2'];

$client_3 = $_POST['client_3'];

$client_4 = $_POST['client_4'];

$client_5 = $_POST['client_5'];

$product = $_POST['product_1'];

$product_2 = $_POST['product_2'];

$product_3 = $_POST['product_3'];

$product_4 = $_POST['product_4'];

$product_5 = $_POST['product_5'];

$price = $_POST['price_1'];

$price_2 = $_POST['price_2'];

$price_3 = $_POST['price_3'];

$price_4 = $_POST['price_4'];

$price_5 = $_POST['price_5'];

$financial = $_POST['financial_1'];

$financial_2 = $_POST['financial_2'];

$financial_3 = $_POST['financial_3'];

$financial_4 = $_POST['financial_4'];

$financial_5 = $_POST['financial_5'];

$emotional = $_POST['emotional_1'];

$emotional_2 = $_POST['emotional_2'];

$emotional_3 = $_POST['emotional_3'];

$emotional_4 = $_POST['emotional_4'];

$emotional_5 = $_POST['emotional_5'];

$physical = $_POST['physical_1'];

$physical_2 = $_POST['physical_2'];

$physical_3 = $_POST['physical_3'];

$physical_4 = $_POST['physical_4'];

$physical_5 = $_POST['physical_5'];

$spiritual = $_POST['spiritual_1'];

$spiritual_2 = $_POST['spiritual_2'];

$spiritual_3 = $_POST['spiritual_3'];

$spiritual_4 = $_POST['spiritual_4'];

$spiritual_5 = $_POST['spiritual_5'];

$dollar = $_POST['dollar_1'];

$dollar_2 = $_POST['dollar_2'];

$dollar_3 = $_POST['dollar_3'];

$dollar_4 = $_POST['dollar_4'];

$dollar_5 = $_POST['dollar_5'];

$Product_name = $_POST['Product_name_1'];

$Product_name_2 = $_POST['Product_name_2'];

$Product_name_3 = $_POST['Product_name_3'];

$Product_name_4 = $_POST['Product_name_4'];

$current_price = $_POST['current_price_1'];

$current_price_2 = $_POST['current_price_2'];

$current_price_3 = $_POST['current_price_3'];

$current_price_4 = $_POST['current_price_4'];

$level_i = $_POST['level_i_1'];

$level_i_2 = $_POST['level_i_2'];

$level_i_3 = $_POST['level_i_3'];

$level_i_4 = $_POST['level_i_4'];

$level_ii = $_POST['level_ii_1'];

$level_ii_2 = $_POST['level_ii_2'];

$level_ii_3 = $_POST['level_ii_3'];

$level_ii_4 = $_POST['level_ii_4'];

$level_iii = $_POST['level_iii_1'];

$level_iii_2 = $_POST['level_iii_2'];

$level_iii_3 = $_POST['level_iii_3'];

$level_iii_4 = $_POST['level_iii_4'];

$level_iv = $_POST['level_iv_1'];

$level_iv_2 = $_POST['level_iv_2'];

$level_iv_3 = $_POST['level_iv_3'];

$level_iv_4 = $_POST['level_iv_4'];

$level_v = $_POST['level_v_1'];

$level_v_2 = $_POST['level_v_2'];

$level_v_3 = $_POST['level_v_3'];

$level_v_4 = $_POST['level_v_4'];

$sick = $_POST['sick_1'];

$sick_2 = $_POST['sick_2'];

$sick_3 = $_POST['sick_3'];

$sick_4 = $_POST['sick_4'];

$fld_user_id = $this->userid;

$fld_added_date = time();



$newData = array(

'client' => $client,

'product' => $product,

'price' => $price,

'financial ' => $financial,

'emotional' => $emotional,

'physical' => $physical,

'spiritual' => $spiritual,

'dollar' => $dollar,

'client_2' => $client_2,

'product_2' => $product_2,

'price_2' => $price_2,

'financial_2 ' => $financial_2,

'emotional_2' => $emotional_2,

'physical_2' => $physical_2,

'spiritual_2' => $spiritual_2,

'dollar_2' => $dollar_2,

'client_3' => $client_3,

'product_3' => $product_3,

'price_3' => $price_3,

'financial_3 ' => $financial_3,

'emotional_3' => $emotional_3,

'physical_3' => $physical_3,

'spiritual_3' => $spiritual_3,

'dollar_3' => $dollar_3,

'client_4' => $client_4,

'product_4' => $product_4,

'price_4' => $price_4,

'financial_4 ' => $financial_4,

'emotional_4' => $emotional_4,

'physical_4' => $physical_4,

'spiritual_4' => $spiritual_4,

'dollar_4' => $dollar_4,

'client_5' => $client_5,

'product_5' => $product_5,

'price_5' => $price_5,

'financial_5 ' => $financial_5,

'emotional_5' => $emotional_5,

'physical_5' => $physical_5,

'spiritual_5' => $spiritual_5,

'dollar_5' => $dollar_5,

'Product_name' => $Product_name,

'current_price' => $current_price,

'level_i' => $level_i,

'level_ii' => $level_ii,

'level_iii' => $level_iii,

'level_iv' => $level_iv,

'level_v' => $level_v,

'sick' => $sick,

'Product_name_2' => $Product_name_2,

'current_price_2' => $current_price_2,

'level_i_2' => $level_i_2,

'level_ii_2' => $level_ii_2,

'level_iii_2' => $level_iii_2,

'level_iv_2' => $level_iv_2,

'level_v_2' => $level_v_2,

'sick_2' => $sick_2,

'Product_name_3' => $Product_name_3,

'current_price_3' => $current_price_3,

'level_i_3' => $level_i_3,

'level_ii_3' => $level_ii_3,

'level_iii_3' => $level_iii_3,

'level_iv_3' => $level_iv_3,

'level_v_3' => $level_v_3,

'sick_3' => $sick_3,

'Product_name_4' => $Product_name_4,

'current_price_4' => $current_price_4,

'level_i_4' => $level_i_4,

'level_ii_4' => $level_ii_4,

'level_iii_4' => $level_iii_4,

'level_iv_4' => $level_iv_4,

'level_v_4' => $level_v_4,

'sick_4' => $sick_4,

'fld_user_id' => $this->userid,

'fld_added_date' =>time(),

);



$fill=$this->db->get_where('user_perfect_pricing',array('fld_user_id'=>$this->userid));

if ($fill->num_rows()>0)

{

$this->db->where('fld_user_id',$this->userid);

$query = $this->db->update('user_perfect_pricing',$newData);

if($query){

echo "<div class=\"alert alert-success\">Form save Successfully!<a href=\"#\" class=\"close\" data-dismiss=\"alert\"
		aria-label=\"close\">&times;</a></div>";

}

}else

{

$query = $this->db->insert('user_perfect_pricing', $newData);

$last_id = $this->db->insert_id();

if($query){

echo "<div class=\"alert alert-success\">Form save Successfully!<a href=\"#\" class=\"close\" data-dismiss=\"alert\"
		aria-label=\"close\">&times;</a></div>";

}

}

}

if(isset($_POST['submit'])){

$client = '<br />1. '.$_POST['client_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['client_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['client_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['client_4'].'<br /><br />5. '.$_POST['client_5'];

$product = '<br />1. '.$_POST['product_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['product_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['product_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['product_4'].'<br /><br />5. '.$_POST['product_5'];

$price = '<br />1. '.$_POST['price_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['price_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['price_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['price_4'].'<br /><br />5. '.$_POST['price_5'];

$financial = '<br />1. '.$_POST['financial_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['financial_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['financial_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['financial_4'].'<br /><br />5. '.$_POST['financial_5'];

$emotional = '<br />1. '.$_POST['emotional_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['emotional_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['emotional_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['emotional_4'].'<br /><br />5. '.$_POST['emotional_5'];

$physical = '<br />1. '.$_POST['physical_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['physical_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['physical_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['physical_4'].'<br /><br />5. '.$_POST['physical_5'];

$spiritual = '<br />1. '.$_POST['spiritual_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['spiritual_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['spiritual_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['spiritual_4'].'<br /><br />5. '.$_POST['spiritual_5'];

$dollar = '<br />1. '.$_POST['dollar_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['dollar_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['dollar_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['dollar_4'].'<br /><br />5. '.$_POST['dollar_5'];

$Product_name = '<br />1. '.$_POST['Product_name_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['Product_name_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['Product_name_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['Product_name_4'];

$current_price = '<br />1. '.$_POST['current_price_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['current_price_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['current_price_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['current_price_4'];

$level_i = '<br />1. '.$_POST['level_i_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['level_i_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['level_i_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['level_i_4'];

$level_ii = '<br />1. '.$_POST['level_ii_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['level_ii_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['level_ii_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['level_ii_4'];

$level_iii = '<br />1. '.$_POST['level_iii_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['level_iii_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['level_iii_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['level_iii_4'];

$level_iv = '<br />1. '.$_POST['level_iv_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['level_iv_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['level_iv_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['level_iv_4'];

$level_v = '<br />1. '.$_POST['level_v_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['level_v_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['level_v_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['level_v_4'];

$sick = '<br />1. '.$_POST['sick_1'].'<br /><br />2. '.$_POST['sick_2'].'<br /><br />3.
'.$_POST['sick_3'].'<br /><br />4. '.$_POST['sick_4'];







$newData = array(

'client' => $client,

'product' => $product,

'price' => $price,

'financial ' => $financial,

'emotional' => $emotional,

'physical' => $physical,

'spiritual' => $spiritual,

'dollar' => $dollar,

'Product_name' => $Product_name,

'current_price' => $current_price,

'level_i' => $level_i,

'level_ii' => $level_ii,

'level_iii' => $level_iii,

'level_iv' => $level_iv,

'level_v' => $level_v,

'sick' => $sick,

'fld_user_id' => $this->userid,

'fld_added_date' =>time()

);

$query = $this->db->insert('perfect_pricing', $newData);

$last_id = $this->db->insert_id();

if($query){

$massage = "

<head>
	<meta http-equiv='Content-Type' content='text/html; charset=windows-1252'>
	<meta name='GENERATOR' content='MSHTML 11.00.10570.1001'>

	</table><strong></strong><strong></strong><strong> </strong>
